tldr: Q2 2025 revenue fell 5.8% QoQ to KRW 74.6T and operating profit declined to KRW 4.7T as DX launch effects faded and DS absorbed inventory adjustments. Management expects a 2H rebound on AI memory demand, reiterated shareholder returns, and detailed HBM3E ramp and foundry order momentum.
bullets: Revenue decreased 5.8% QoQ to KRW 74.6T with operating profit of KRW 4.7T and a 6.3% margin.
DS sales rose 11% QoQ on HBM3E and DDR5, while DX revenue fell 16% after smartphone launch effects.
CapEx was KRW 11.1T (DS KRW 9.8T, display KRW 0.8T) and the KRW 10T buyback is set to complete by October.

segments.title: Device Solutions (DS)
points: Revenue increased 11% QoQ on higher HBM3E and DDR5 sales and foundry customer expansion.
Memory recognized inventory valuation adjustments; non-memory booked one-off costs tied to China export restrictions.

segments.title: Device eXperience (DX)
points: Revenue declined 16% QoQ due to fading smartphone launch effects and TV competition.
MX planned premium AI device growth with foldables and XR to offset tariff risks.

guidance.label: 2H outlook
guidance.note: AI memory demand and improved utilization

notes.title: Shareholder returns
points: Quarterly dividend of KRW 367 per share; KRW 2.45T payout due late August.
KRW 10T buyback ahead of schedule, completion expected by Oct 8.

notes.title: Memory trends
points: DRAM bit growth up low 10% QoQ; NAND bit growth up high 20% QoQ.
HBM3E shipments increased and HBM4 development progressed with customer samples.

themes.title: HBM roadmap
points: HBM3E mix reached high 80% of HBM volume; HBM4 samples shipped.
Hybrid copper bonding discussions ongoing with key customers.

themes.title: Foundry profitability
points: Losses driven by low utilization and one-off write-downs; improvement expected in 2H.
Tesla order win supports advanced node utilization and Taylor Fab ramp.

top_questions.question: What is the HBM outlook for 2H?
top_questions.summary: HBM sales are expected to recover step-by-step with HBM3E expansion and HBM4 ramp planning.

top_questions.question: How will tariffs affect memory demand?
top_questions.summary: Preemptive purchasing may pull forward demand, but Samsung plans flexible mix management to protect profitability.

top_questions.question: Will foundry losses narrow in 2H?
top_questions.summary: Management expects higher utilization and advanced node ramps to improve profitability.

implications: Inventory adjustments reset DS earnings but set a cleaner base for 2H rebound.
Foundry order momentum (Tesla) improves credibility in advanced nodes.
competitive_notes: DX faces intensified TV competition while premium AI devices remain the margin lever.
